E-SHOPS

E-SHOPS

01

Why JubioKenya

E-shop - 24/7 salesman who needs to be in the right place at the right time with the right reliable offer to satisfy the customer's needs.In addition to building e-stores, our team members have been e-store owners and faced the problems we want to solve for our customers today. Our nearly 30-member team has sufficient competences to build you e-shops that are more effective than competitors and to integrate different business and marketing systems as a whole.

02

So who wins?

The winner is the one who can leave himself in the customer's journey at the right time and in the right place and satisfy the opportunity given to him in a way that suits the buyer.

Who gets the customer?

It is necessary to make e-business available to the customer online. St. he must find you and want to come to your page. It is necessary to contribute to SEO activities in order to improve findability on the Internet. You can pay for internet advertising. In both cases, your page must be technically and in good order in order for Google to promote you and be willing to promote your page for money.

03

Who gets the sale?

If the customer is already on your page looking for information and wondering, then you have already won. Unless you are selling the most unique thing in the world, you can be sure that the customer will visit other pages as well. As humans, we have the notion in the back of our heads that the cheapest offer wins. You can't win, before the price there are other factors that influence the purchase decision, especially if the price difference is within the customer's price tolerance. Reliability. Ease of use. Understanding the product, whether the buyer understands that this product is correct and whether the buyer becomes convinced that the seller knows what he is selling.

Business Areas We Have Already Encountered

  • AI solutions in furniture production and furniture sales solutions.
  • Real estate brokerage platform.
  • Pharmaceutical wholesale and retail logistics, including robotics solutions and cash register systems
  • Establish a LeadGen procesCar goods and integration of car rental mediation platformss
  • Financial technologies in the lending and investment business B2C and P2P

Work Process

01

Let's meet and talk about goals

You are building your e-shop 2.0 and you already know how to avoid beginner's mistakes?

You don't have a starting task and you know how long it takes to put together a good task?

You already have a starting task for creating a new store and only need to take offers?

If you have not yet completed the initial task and business analysis, before the interview we will send you a separate questionnaire, on the basis of which you can think a little about your e-business. It seems trivial, but unfortunately, many of our customers do not think as deeply about their e-business on a daily basis as it would be necessary to build a good thing. So let's think about this business together.

02

Business analysis

The analysis work is necessary so that both you and us can understand together what the goal of your e-business development is and what needs to be done to achieve the goal. What result must be achieved at the end of the development work? What are the business goals for the coming years and what must be done during business as usual processes to achieve these goals. The result of the business analysis work does not bind you to us and does not oblige you to create a partnership for e-business development and later further development with us.

03

E-business processes

If e-business processes are not mapped in a reproducible form, we try to understand them ourselves through interviews. We try to understand why something is done the way it is being done now (as-is). As a result, as a rule, we come to the need to change some part of the processes and work instructions when the new system is ready. As a rule, we find process improvement ideas that can be implemented and tested immediately when doing business with an existing store. Creating a new e-shop can take 3 months to a year. Also during this time, there is reason to change existing business processes and test them to earn more money or save costs.

How we deliver

We have the information of customer interviews and their desire to shop. We also have online behavior analytics. We have information about how customers would like and how they can find a solution to their problem today. We also have information on how and what you as a merchant want to sell. Based on this information, we can create the structure of the e-store. In the structure, we combine the expectations of users and the business wisdom of the store owner. The result of the stage's work is the described structure and functionalities. Functional views are drawn in wireframes. Wireframe gives an initial understanding of what type of information will be located somewhere on the page. This is a picture with black and white lines.

Are You Ready?
